titleStmt.title: National Library of Sweden, A 162
titleStmt.sponsor: Medieval Latin Manuscripts in the National Library: Cataloguing and Digitization
titleStmt.funder: Riksbankens jubileumsfond – The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

supportDesc.foliation: Modern pagination in pencil (page number on every recto). : modern foliation in black ink in the bottom right corner. Hoc inquit Fratres

collation.catchwords: Catchwords at the end of each quire, except for quire 4.

p.note: Top of page in pencil and red crayon by a modern hand: 18 ??; 7OC; ?ü? 18X CM; 10 4; in black ink by a modern hand: Inköpt från F. Butsch i Augsburg Juni 1870 för 3 fl. 30 kr Katal. LXVIII n. 222.; bottom left corner: National Library book label with current signum.
Bottom right corner in red crayon and pencil by a modern hand: 10 9 54, 30. 3. 54 , W J. Th, C. G?.
Bottom right corner in pencil by a modern hand: 10/9/5h W 6 Y.

binding.p: Modern binding. Cloth and marbled paper over cardboard. , ink on paper label: Suso Horologium aeternae Sapientiae; stamped in gold: A 162.

provenance.p:
Provenance unknown. During the 19th century the manuscript belonged to the book dealer and collector Fidelis Butsch
in Augsburg.

acquisition.p: Purchased by the National Library from F. Butsch in Augsburg in June .

msItem.title: Horologium sapientiae
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus in horologium Sapiencie capitulum primum
msItem.incipit: SEntite de domino in bonitate et in simplicitate cordis querite illum
msItem.explicit: te regem glorie dominumque virtutum in decore suo conspicientes ihesum christum dominum nostrum qui cum patre et spiritu sancto viuit et regnat per omnia secula seculorum Amen
msItem.colophon: Explicit horologium Sapiencie Anno Domini Millesimo Trecentesimo nonagesimo Quinto Completum in Die Quatuor Coronatorum hora quasi Conpletorii vivat qui scripsit viuat qui scribere iussit per manus fratris Tilmanni pie memorie

watermark.term: Oxhead with eyes, nostrils, and ears, above single line rod with star on top.

supportDesc.condition: Paper stained throughout with some effect on legibility, e.g. . : dark and stained, which indicates the manuscript may have been stored without binding for some time. In the corners there are holes with rust stains, which partially bleeds through to . Edges trimmed, with some loss of marignal additions. : holes from bookworms. Leaves repaired and strengthened with paper strips in places, e.g. and .

p.note: Upper part of page, around the rubric: traces of writing by a later hand in dark ink; bottom of page: letters in red ink, only partially legible due to trimming.
Scattered corrections in the margin by the scribe and at least one other hand. Occasional manicules in the margin, e.g. on .

decoDesc.p: Main text in brown ink, rubrics in red, capitals touched in red.

decoNote.p: : opening plain initial S over 8 lines in red. : plain initials over 3-5 lines in red, some with interior reserved shapes.
